intro: Pedicularis tsangchanensis, commonly known as the Tsangchan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, often at high altitudes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptation make it a notable species in the study of high-altitude flora.
